samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. Since its initial development, R has become an open-source project maintained by the R Core Team.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was developed as an implementation of the S programming language with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names. Since its initial development, R has become an open-source project maintained by the R Core Team.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R after its initial development, which began in the 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. Prior to version 1.0, there were various beta versions as the language was being developed.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first stable release of R after its initial development, which began in the 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. Prior to version 1.0, there were various beta versions as the language was being developed.
